Functions
force_add
def force_add(
root,
entries,
conn
)

Called when a user hits the 'add' button. Checks for slot, row and classroom (if added) existance. Also checks for pre-added course anomaly and adds the course to database.

Parameters
root

the main tkinter window/frame object.

entries

entries is a python dictionary object containing the fields: "Slot", "Row", "Course code" and "Classroom" of the record.

conn

conn is a connection object that represents the database and using which we can manipulate the database.

Returns

None.

constraint_check
def constraint_check(
root,
entries,
conn
)

Called when a user hits the 'constraint check' button. Applies the Classroom, Instructor, Core course, Basket Course constraints on the record entered. Gives warning regarding each constraint if found anomaly.

Parameters
root

the main tkinter window/frame object.

entries

entries is a python dictionary object containing the fields: "Slot", "Row", "Course code" and "Classroom" of the record.

conn

conn is a connection object that represents the database and using which we can manipulate the database.

Returns

None.

deletion
def deletion(
root,
entries,
conn
)

Called when a user hits the delete button. Its function is to delete a given entry from the slotwise course distribution table and all its occurances in the database.

Parameters
root

the main tkinter window/frame object.

entries

entries is a python dictionary object containing the fields: "Slot" and "Row" of the record to be deleted.

conn

conn is a connection object that represents the database and using which we can manipulate the database.

Returns

None.

addclass
def addclass(
root,
entries,
conn
)

Called when a user hits the 'add classroom' button. Add a class or update the class of an existing record.

Parameters
root

the main tkinter window/frame object.

entries

entries is a python dictionary object containing the fields: "Slot" ,"Row" and "classroom" of the record.

conn

conn is a connection object that represents the database and using which we can manipulate the database.

Returns

None.

remember
def remember(
root,
conn
)

Reads the existing entries in Allocated_Subjs table and displays at appropriate positions.  Parameters: root - the main tkinter window/frame object.  conn - a connection object that represents the database and using which we can manipulate the database.

Returns

None.

An assisting function to the function 'generate' which writes entries into the csv file

Parameters

filename

gives the filename chosen by user

Returns

entries

entries is a python dictionary object containing the fields: "Slot", "Row", "Course code" and "Classroom" of the record

Returns

reload
def reload(
root,
conni,
entries
)

Called when user wants to completely remove all the existing database tables and create new ones.

Parameters
root

the main tkinter window/frame object.

conni

a connection object that represents the database and using which we can manipulate the database.

entries

entries is a python dictionary object containing the fields: "Slot", "Row", "Course code" and "Classroom" of the record

Returns

None.

makeform
def makeform(
root,
fields,
base
)

Create the slotwise distributed table and create forms for requesting courses/classrooms to be added or deleted from the slotwise distribution table.

Parameters
root

the main tkinter window/frame object.

fields

contains a tuple of form entries/fields that need to be added in the GUI.

base

start marker for adding form entries on the grid.

Returns

returns all the form's entry objects in the form of python dictionary object.
